conversation.content: Um, yeah so. Parking reimbursement. Still not in my account. I'm, uh, literally at work right now.
Oh gosh, I'm so sorry about that. Let me pull up your account here, can I get your email associated with the reimbursement request?
It's, um, jmartin at, uh, quickbite dot com. Like, I submitted this thing. Two weeks ago.
Okay so, um, I'm seeing your request here, it's... um, what's the... it's showing as RMB-4429-JX and, uh, I'm really, really sorry but it looks like it's, um, stuck in processing?
Stuck. Of course it's stuck. Great.
I'm so, so sorry about this, um, I know this must be really... uh, frustrating and I'm going to, um, let me see what I can... actually, hmm, I might be able to expedite this for you.
Hmm, let me see here... I have, um, maybe ten minutes. Before my next run. So, uh, whatever you can do.
Right right, absolutely. So your parking receipt PRC-8837-M shows forty-two dollars, and I can push this through our urgent queue right now.
Forty-two dollars. That's been sitting there. Two weeks.
I know, I know, and um, I'm really, uh, this shouldn't have happened and I'm so sorry. Let me, um, actually I can process this as, uh, what's it called... an instant credit while we're on the phone?
Um, instant? Like, uh, actually instant or, you know, "instant" instant?
No no, like, um, actually instant! So, uh, I'm putting through code EXP-9024-RT and, um, you should see it in, hmm, literally about thirty seconds to your account.
Thirty seconds. Sure. I'll believe it when I see it.
It's going to be okay, I promise. The system just confirmed it with transaction TXN-445892-QP, and this is going straight to your linked bank.
Okay so that means... um, wait, I'm actually, uh, seeing something pop up on my phone here.
Yes! That's, um, that should be it! And, uh, again I'm so, so sorry about the delay, I'm also, um, adding a ten dollar credit, code CRD-1156-V for the, uh, for the inconvenience.
Oh. It actually went through. Huh.
It did! And, um, I've made a note on your account, ACC-7799-BNX, so, uh, next time any parking stuff will be, um, automatically prioritized so this won't... it won't happen again.
Next time. Right. Well. Thanks for actually fixing it.
Of course! And, um, I really am sorry you had to, uh, call during work and, you know, deal with this. Is there, um, anything else I can help with today?

scenario: food runner, wanting a quick resolution to a parking reimbursement issue so he can return to work
